headline.main: Gene Factor Seen in Blacks' Diabetes

docs.lead_paragraph: Black Americans appear to have a genetic predisposition to diabetes that may be set off by obesity or other health habits, and therefore simple changes in a person's way of life can lower the risk, diabetes experts say. "This is a problem we can beat and it's time to begin," Dr. James Gavin said in unveiling the American Diabetes Association's African-American Program on Monday. The $500,000 education campaign will cover how to prevent and control diabetes, a disease where the body either does not produce enough insulin or cannot use the hormone properly.
